title: Speed of an object after work done

content.description: An object of mass <math alttext="4 kilograms " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> initially at rest on a surface has both kinetic and potential energies equal to zero. It is then lifted under the influence of both nonconservative forces and the conservative force of gravity. The nonconservative forces do <math alttext="positive 40 joules " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>40</mn><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of work on the object. The conservative force does <math alttext="negative 22 joules " overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>22</mn><mtext> J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of work.
content.question: The speed of the object at the end of the motion is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="3.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="4.5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.5</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="9.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9.0</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="18 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="20 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
